meanings.definition: A plug or stopper used to close the muzzle of a cannon or other firearm.
meanings.sent1: The soldier carefully inserted the tampions into the cannon before battle.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to remove the tampions from the cannons before firing.
meanings.sent3: The tampions decided to have a race to see who could plug the cannon faster.
meanings.sent4: The tampions stood guard at the mouth of the cannon, ready to protect the soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The shiny tampions gleamed in the sunlight, ready for action.

meanings.definition: A plug or stopper used to seal the opening of a pipe or vessel.
meanings.sent1: The plumber used tampions to seal the leak in the pipe.
meanings.sent2: Remember to check the tampions on the pipes regularly to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: The tampions threw a party inside the sealed pipe, celebrating their job well done.
meanings.sent4: The tampions worked together to keep the water safely inside the vessel.
meanings.sent5: The tampions fit perfectly, ensuring no water would escape.

meanings.definition: A plug or stopper used to cover the end of a cigar or pipe to keep it from drying out.
meanings.sent1: He always uses tampions to keep his cigars fresh.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to replace the tampions on your pipes to maintain their quality.
meanings.sent3: The tampions threw a surprise party for the cigar, keeping it moist and happy.
meanings.sent4: The tampions were like loyal guards, protecting the cigars from drying out.
meanings.sent5: The tampions hugged the cigar tightly, preserving its flavor.
